info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 29 at 3:47PM CDT by NWS Green Bay WI
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Green Bay has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Wisconsin...
Big Rib River at Rib Falls affecting Marathon County.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued Sunday morning by 700 AM CDT.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. The river was reported to be peaking, so river levels should begin to fall again after precipitation ends tomorrow.
* WHERE...Big Rib River at Rib Falls.
* WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, The water current is fast in the Rib Falls area. Widespread lowland flooding is occurring downstream to western Wausau. In Marathon City...several feet of water is covering Lions Park and water is surrounding homes near River Road north of Marathon City.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 12.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 7.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 AM CDT Saturday was 12.8 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE
